message_1: A group of 100 patients were diagnosed with a particular disease. Out of these, 60 survived for more than 5 years following the treatment. Using survival analysis, find out the probability of surviving for more than 5 years following the treatment for a random patient with the same disease.
message_2:
To find the probability of surviving for more than 5 years following the treatment for a random patient with the same disease, we can use the proportion of patients who survived for more than 5 years out of the total number of patients.

Probability of surviving more than 5 years = (Number of patients who survived more than 5 years) / (Total number of patients)

Probability of surviving more than 5 years = 60 / 100

Probability of surviving more than 5 years = 0.6

So, the probability of surviving for more than 5 years following the treatment for a random patient with the same disease is 0.6 or 60%.
